document.name: AI Multiplayer Quiz
document.description: Target Blue document to be bootstrapped

type.name: Lifecycle Event Channel
type.description:
A channel for lifecycle events in the document (e.g., processing initiation).
You can optionally provide an event pattern to filter which lifecycle events are handled.

type.name: Channel
type.description: Generic channel

type.name: Lifecycle Event
type.description: A type of event that signals a significant change in a document's lifecycle.

type.name: Event
type.description: Represents a generic event that can occur within the system.

type.name: Event
type.description: Represents a generic event that can occur within the system.

type.name: Triggered Event Channel
type.description:
A channel for documentâ€‘internal custom events produced during processing.
It is intended for locally generated events within the document, not for
external timeline entries.

startRound.description: Starts a round by setting question/options (no correct answer here!)

type.name: Operation
type.description: Named, structured interfaces that documents expose to the outside world. They define specific actions that can be performed on a document, complete with formal request definitions.

channel.description: Specifies the channel through which Operation Request events are sent to invoke this operation on the document.

request.description: Defines the expected input structure and validation rules for the operation. This represents the data that will be passed when the operation is invoked.

channel.description: Specifies the channel through which Operation Request events are sent to invoke this operation on the document.

request.description: Defines the expected input structure and validation rules for the operation. This represents the data that will be passed when the operation is invoked.

type.name: Sequential Workflow Operation
type.description: The most common approach for implementing operations. Links to an operation definition and defines processing steps that execute sequentially when the operation is called.

type.name: Sequential Workflow
type.description: A sequential workflow that executes its steps in a linear order.

channel.description: Name of the channel this workflow listens to.

event.description: Optional event-type criteria to filter incoming events from the channel.

channel.description: Name of the channel this workflow listens to.

event.description: Optional event-type criteria to filter incoming events from the channel.

operation.description: References the name of the operation definition that this implementation serves. Links this workflow to a specific Operation contract.

channel.description: Name of the channel this workflow listens to.

event.description: Optional event-type criteria to filter incoming events from the channel.

type.name: JavaScript Code
type.description: A workflow step that executes a JavaScript code.

type.name: Sequential Workflow Step
type.description: Represents a single step within a workflow.

operation.description: References the name of the operation definition that this implementation serves. Links this workflow to a specific Operation contract.

completeRound.description: Completes the round with the authoritative correct option

type.name: Status In Progress
type.description:
Represents active processing of the document, often used for processes that involve
multiple steps over time.

type.name: Document Status
type.description: The base type for all document status indicators.

mode.description:
Defines the high-level phase of the document's lifecycle. Must be one of:
  pending: The document is waiting for a pre-condition before its core logic begins.
  active: The document is in its main operational phase, actively processing events.
  terminated: The document has reached a final, conclusive state.

Defines the high-level phase of the document's lifecycle. Must be one of:
  pending: The document is waiting for a pre-condition before its core logic begins.
  active: The document is in its main operational phase, actively processing events.
  terminated: The document has reached a final, conclusive state.

Defines the high-level phase of the document's lifecycle. Must be one of:
  pending: The document is waiting for a pre-condition before its core logic begins.
  active: The document is in its main operational phase, actively processing events.
  terminated: The document has reached a final, conclusive state.

type.name: Status Completed
type.description:
A successful final state. The document has achieved its goal and its
process has finished as expected.

  pending: The document is waiting for a pre-condition before its core logic begins.
  active: The document is in its main operational phase, actively processing events.
  terminated: The document has reached a final, conclusive state.
